lines.gurmukhi: jYsy KwNf cUn GiRq hoq Gr ibKY pY pwhunw kY Awey pUrI kY Kuvwie KweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Khaand Choon Ghrit Hot Ghar Bikhai Pai , Paahounaa Kai Aaay Pooree Kai Khuvaai Khaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as flour, sugar and oil are kept at home, and on arrival of some guests, sweet dishes are prepared, served and eaten.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy cIr hwr mukqw knk AwBrn pY bRXwhu kwj swij qn sujn idKweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Cheer Haar Moukataa Kanak Aabharan Pai , Byaahu Kaaj Saaji Tan Sujan Dikhaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as beautiful dresses, pearl necklace and gold jewellery are in possession but are worn on special occasions like marriage and are shown to others.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy hIrw mwink Amol hoq hwt hI mYN gwh kY idKwie ibVqw ibsyK pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Heeraa Maanik Amol Hot Haat Hee Main , Gaah Kai Dikhaai Birhataa Bisaykh Paaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as valuable pearls and jewels are kept in the shop, but shopkeeper shows them to the customer to sell and earn profit.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurbwnI ilK poQI bwNiD rwKIAq iml guris`K piV suin ilv lweIAY ]562]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gurbaanee Likh Podee Baandhi Raakheeata , Mil Gursikh Parhi Souni Liv Laaeeai ?562?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly Gurbani is written in a book form, it is bound and preserved. But when the Sikhs of Guru assemble in a congregation, that book is read and heard and it helps one attach the mind in the holy feet of the Lord.
